snippet: The proposal comes amid sharp criticism from advocacy groups and Congress over how the military has handled a series of sexual assault cases.
abstract: Pentagon announces that it will ask Congress to overhaul court-martial system used to prosecute nearly 5,000 service members annually accused of crimes, scaling back power of senior commanders to overturn convictions and dismiss charges; proposal comes amid sharp criticism over how series of sexual assault cases have been handled by military.
lead_paragraph: The proposal comes amid sharp criticism from advocacy groups and Congress over how the military has handled a series of sexual assault cases.

headline.seo: Pentagon to Ask Congress to Overhaul Court-Martial System
headline.main: Amid Criticism, Pentagon Seeks Overhaul of the Court-Martial System
headline.print_headline: Amid Criticism, Pentagon Is Seeking Overhaul of the Court-Martial System

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
